qas.question: What do historians and researches argue about concerning the emotional and affectionate activities?

answers.text: activities associated with sexual-orientation terms such as "gay" and "heterosexual" change significantly over time and across cultural boundaries.

qas.question: What can be assumed in english speaking nations when two men kiss?
What do some cultures have formal ceremonies for?

answers.text: expressing long-term commitment between same-sex friends

context: Some historians and researchers argue that the emotional and affectionate <a0_0>activities associated with sexual-orientation terms such as "gay" and "heterosexual" change significantly over time and across cultural boundaries.<a0_0/> For example, in many English-speaking nations, it is assumed that same-sex kissing, particularly between men, <a1_0>is a sign of homosexuality<a1_0/>, whereas various types of same-sex kissing are common expressions of friendship in other nations. Also, many modern and historic cultures have formal ceremonies <a2_0>expressing long-term commitment between same-sex friends<a2_0/>, even though homosexuality itself is taboo within the cultures.
